subject: Math
goals: Familiarize with the basic concepts of limits and continuity, which are the foundation for understanding calculus.
milestones: Understand the definition of a limit, be able to evaluate limits using basic algebra, and identify whether a function is continuous at a point.

timetable.session: 2-hour session divided into two 1-hour segments across the week.

learning_tasks.task: Introduction to Limits and Continuity - Read textbook chapter or watch educational video on the concepts.
Work through examples of limit calculations from the textbook or online resources.

practice_tasks.task: Complete a set of exercises on evaluating limits.

resources: Recommended textbook: 'Calculus: Early Transcendentals' by James Stewart. Online resources: Khan Academy videos on Limits and Continuity.
